thread.title: Delta invests $450 million to expand partnership with China airline
thread.title_full: Delta invests $450 million to expand partnership with China airline

author: Carla Caldwell
title: Delta invests $450 million to expand partnership with China airline
text:
Delta invests $450 million to expand partnership with China airline Jul 27, 2015, 7:56am EDT Industries & Tags Carla Caldwell Morning Edition Editor Atlanta Business Chronicle Carla Caldwell Morning Edition Editor Atlanta Business Chronicle Related Content Byron E. Small Delta Air Lines jets at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport. Delta Air Lines Inc. (NYSE: DAL) and China Eastern Airlines Corp. (NYSE: CEA) signed an agreement Monday to expand their partnership and better connect Delta's global network with China Eastern,a leading airline in China. The agreement includes a $450 million investment by Delta to acquire a 3.55 percent stake in China Eastern, Delta said in a statement. This move marks a significant step in the airlines' collaboration and partnership that will allow Delta and China Eastern to compete more effectively on routes between the U.S. and China, provide more travel options for customers in both countries and make joint investments in the customer experience, the Atlanta-based carrier said. "Delta's relationship with China Eastern is long-standing,” said Delta Chief Executive Officer Richard Anderson . “We share a vision that will create the most profitable, enduring franchise between the U.S. and China, with world-class customer service. For the past three years, Delta has welcomed members of the China Eastern team at our headquarters for sharing best practices and work study opportunities. We have learned much from one another already and look forward to deepening our already effective partnership." China Eastern, with its wholly owned subsidiary Shanghai Airlines, and Delta currently operate codeshare flights on 30 domestic routes in the U.S., 43 domestic routes in China and seven trans-Pacific routes between China and the U.S. Under the agreement: China Eastern in the U.S. China Eastern will operate 35 weekly departures to four destinations in the U.S. from Shanghai , two flights a day to Los Angeles , dailyto New York , San Francisco and Hawaii , also three flights a week from NanJing to Los Angeles. Delta in China Delta will operate 28 weekly departures to Shanghai this summer. Delta also offers daily service to China's capital, Beijing, from Seattle and Detroit and to Hong Kong from Seattle . Delta has grown its China network by nearly three times in the past five years. The partnership with China Eastern is part of Delta's broader strategy to collaborate and expand services to China.
